intro: Bocoa limae, commonly known as the Mexican coffee tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small red berries that contain a single seed, which is used to make a specialty coffee known as "café de oca." Bocoa limae thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its unique coffee beans.
